body: This is a pretty serious issue for us.  Basically we have a "real-time" application running in Node.JS and Electron is causing it to halt for arbitrary long periods if someone moves the window around.  This is not an issue with standard GUI applications on Windows or Ubuntu, rather this limitation of locking the main loop when the window is being moved is imposed by either Chromium or Electron.

Hey @lanigela, thanks for posting the detailed repro-case.

I know we're looking at node-integration into web-workers, which can run in their own threads. If you or @bhouston have any more information about your applications, we could use that as a user-story when working on the feature.

We can also have a look and see if this problem is avoidable, or too baked into the architecture to avoid without using other threads.
This is very likely a duplicate of #7079.
